name: American Alligator
description: The American Alligator is a large reptile native to the southeastern United States, known for its powerful jaws and armored body.
spread_note: Found primarily in the southeastern United States, including Florida, Louisiana, and Georgia.
food: Fish, birds, mammals, and occasionally carrion.
food_note: Opportunistic feeders, they can eat a wide variety of prey depending on availability.
proportions: Adults can grow up to 11-15 feet (3.4-4.6 meters) in length and weigh up to 1,000 pounds (450 kg).
reproduction: Oviparous, females lay 20-50 eggs in a nest of vegetation, which hatch after about 65 days.
attractions: Known for their impressive size and strength, often featured in wildlife tours and educational programs.
projects_note: Conservation efforts have helped recover populations from earlier declines.
breeding: Captive breeding programs exist in zoos and wildlife parks.
